intro: Sphaerostephanos rudis var. micans, commonly known as the glittering starflower, is a rare and striking plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its small, star-shaped flowers that shimmer with a metallic sheen, particularly in sunlight. The plant thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to high-altitude environments. Its foliage consists of narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine, silky hairs. Due to its limited distribution and unique appearance, it is considered a valuable species in botanical studies and conservation efforts.
